abstract: The prospect that a group backed by China may make a takeover offer for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan has Washington lawmakers, Canadian regulators and Wall Street bankers talking.
snippet: The prospect that a group backed by China may make a takeover offer for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan has Washington lawmakers, Canadian regulators and Wall Street bankers talking.
lead_paragraph: The prospect that a group backed by China may make a takeover offer for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan that rivals a $38.6 billion hostile bid from BHP Billiton has Washington lawmakers, Canadian regulators and Wall Street bankers talking, The New York Times’s Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.

headline.main: Sorkin: Worrying Over China and Food
